newsitem.title: FRANCE: PRESS DIGEST - France - Le Monde Sept 4.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - France - Le Monde Sept 4.

text.p: These are leading stories in afternoon daily Le Monde.
-- Government to cut income tax by 25 billion francs in 1997, while taxes on tobacco, alcohol and fuel are expected to rise.
-- Snecma aircraft engine manufacturer and U.S. General Electric seek to reconcile after months of disagreement.
-- Lyonnaise des Eaux wins water supply deal in Turkey.
-- Credit Local de France announces six percent rise in profits
-- Bull French computer group considers selling printer manufacturing subsidiary.
-- Bally France shoes manufacturer files for bankruptcy.
-- National Statistics Office INSEE reports French wealth still concentrated in just a few hands, with the richest five percent of the population owning around 40 percent of the assets.
